verbs.description: President Donald Trump [V: has] welcomed to the White House an American held for two years in a Venezuelan jail , saying the Utah man has undergone a " very tough ordeal . "

[ARG0: President Donald Trump] has [V: welcomed] [ARG2: to the White House] [ARG1: an American held for two years in a Venezuelan jail] , [ARGM-ADV: saying the Utah man has undergone a " very tough ordeal] . "

President Donald Trump has welcomed to the White House [ARG1: an American] [V: held] [ARGM-TMP: for two years] [ARGM-LOC: in a Venezuelan jail] , saying the Utah man has undergone a " very tough ordeal . "
[ARG0: President Donald Trump] has welcomed to the White House an American held for two years in a Venezuelan jail , [V: saying] [ARG1: the Utah man has undergone a " very tough ordeal] . "
President Donald Trump has welcomed to the White House an American held for two years in a Venezuelan jail , saying the Utah man [V: has] undergone a " very tough ordeal . "
President Donald Trump has welcomed to the White House an American held for two years in a Venezuelan jail , saying [ARG1: the Utah man] has [V: undergone] [ARG2: a " very tough ordeal] . "
